intro: Eschscholzia benedicta, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers and slender, branched stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of four petals arranged in a radial pattern. Eschscholzia benedicta is an annual herb that plays a significant role in the ecological and cultural landscapes of its native region.
